summary: To attract innovative companies that may not traditionally do business with DOD, the department can use flexible agreements known as “other transactions.” Other transactions are not subject to certain federal contract laws and requirements. We found DOD’s use of these transactions for prototype projects significantly increased since 2016 and 88% of those awarded included companies with whom DOD does not typically do business. Our in-depth...
title: Defense Acquisitions: DOD's Use of Other Transactions for Prototype Projects Has Increased
